meanings.definition: More snug or tight in fit or position.
meanings.sent1: The kitten found a snugger spot to nap in the warm blanket.
meanings.sent2: She wore a snugger sweater to stay warm in the cold weather.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to squeeze into a snugger tree hollow but got stuck!
meanings.sent4: The puzzle pieces fit snugger together than expected, creating a perfect picture.
meanings.sent5: The hug from her mom felt snugger than any other, making her feel safe and loved.

meanings.definition: One who or that which makes snug.
meanings.sent1: The tailor was known as the best snugger in town for altering clothes perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The blanket was a great snugger, keeping the baby warm and cozy.
meanings.sent3: The pillow was a sneaky snugger, hiding the remote control from view.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter's tool was a master snugger, ensuring all joints were tight and secure.
meanings.sent5: The mother was a natural snugger, always making sure her children felt safe and protected.
